intro: Psychotria integristipulata, commonly known as the red-eyed or red-veined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Psychotria integristipulata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is known for its small, clustered white or pink flowers.
